required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Immunosuppression Reduction in Failed Allograft Guided by cfDNA
clinical_study.official_title: Immunosuppression Reduction in Failed Allograft Guided by cfDNA

brief_summary.textblock: The optimal timing for immunosuppression tapering for patients with failed kidney transplant is not known. This pilot study would be to correlate rise in cf-DNA and increase in cPRA.

detailed_description.textblock: This is an observational cohort study collecting data and blood specimens at designated time points. The primary outcome will be comparing the cPRA in patients that have a rise in cf-DNA to those that do not have a rise in cf-DNA. Seondary outcomes include comparison of the combined incidence of need for transfusion, need for methylprednisolone and allograft nephrectomy, ESA dose, allograft tenderness, and gross hematuria.

primary_outcome.description: Outcome is reported as the serum concentration of calculated Panel Reactive Antibody (cPRA) at baseline.
Outcome is reported as the serum concentration of circulating-free DNA (cfDNA) at baseline, 4 weeks, 8 weeks, 12 weeks, 16 weeks, 20 weeks, and 24 weeks.

secondary_outcome.description: Outcome is reported as the percent of participants who require transfusion.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of Need for Methylprednisolone and Allograft Nephrectomy
secondary_outcome.description: Outcome is reported as the percent of participants who require methylprednisolone and allograft nephrectomy
Outcome is reported as the percent of participants who require a erythropoesis stimulating agent (ESA) dose.
Outcome is reported as the percent of participants who experience allograft tenderness.
Outcome is reported as the percent of participants who experience gross hematuria.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Kidney Transplant Patients with Failed Allograft
arm_group.description: All participants are assigned to a single cohort of kidney transplant patients with failed allograft requiring dialysis.

intervention.description: Participants will have blood drawn for analysis at baseline and every 4 weeks for a total of 7 blood draws over 24 weeks.
intervention.arm_group_label: Kidney Transplant Patients with Failed Allograft

biospec_descr.textblock: Specimens will be stored by study code. All study data will be associated with the specimen through the study code link.

study_pop.textblock: This study proposes to recruit adult patients primarily from the inpatient units at UMMC Fairview, or the Renal or Transplant facilities at the Clinics and Surgery Center as attended by the PI and Co-Is. Additional clinics will be recruited from depending on patient population and clinician support.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Failed allograft requiring dialysis
- Urine output less than 500 cc/day
- No living donor available for re-transplant option or anticipated deceased donor within the next 12 months
Exclusion Criteria:
- cPRA at entrance of 100%
